intro: Plectritis suksdorfii var. alba, commonly known as the white tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It is an annual herb that produces seeds in small, composite flower clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
